March 1963C (63)41 Copy No. 5211th March, 1963CABINETFUTURE AGRICULTURAL policy note by the Secretary of the CabinetThe attached note is circulated for the information of the Cabinet.(Signed) BURKE TREND.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,11th March, 1963.ANNEXFUTURE AGRICULTURAL POLICYAfter discussion in the Economic Policy Committee of the memoranda by theChancellor of the Exchequer and the Minister of Agriculture which were circulated for the information of the Cabinet under C. (63) 33 and C. (63) 38 respectively,the following paragraph on future policy was agreed between those Ministers,and in consultation with the Departments concerned, for inclusion in the white paper on the Agricultural Annual Review, .1963:" The cost of agricultural support to the Exchequer has risen steeply inrecent years from 263 million in 1960-61 to an estimated 364 million in thecoming year. Changes are needed to bring this cost under more effective control whilst still ensuring a fair standard of living for the agriculturalcommunity and maintaining broadly the present balance between home-grown and imported food. The changes in the guarantee arrangements for livestock products referred to in the earlier paragraphs are a first step. During the months ahead the Government will be discussing fuller proposals with theleaders of the industry and with Commonwealth and other countries whosupply foodstuffs to this market."2219
